newsitem.title: FRANCE: France to cut payroll taxes, raise CSG - paper.
newsitem.headline: France to cut payroll taxes, raise CSG - paper.

text.p: France's conservative government is planning to reduce healthcare payroll taxes by 1.3 percentage points in 1997, financial daily Les Echos reported on Wednesday.
The paper said this would be offset by a widening of the scope of the generalised social contribution (CSG), a tax on most income.

France's generous welfare system is now financed through payroll deductions, many paid by the employer, and the government has said it wants to shift the system's financing away from payroll taxes and onto income and other forms of revenue.
The government is hoping to increase labour market flexibility and encourage hiring through this change.
